Key Match Events: Gerrit Cole pitched like a postseason ace, holding the Kansas City Royals to a single run over seven innings.
Clay Holmes tossed a perfect eighth inning and Luke Weaver breezed through the ninth, extending the scoreless streak by Yankees relievers to 15 and two-thirds innings this postseason.
Juan Soto, Gleyber Torres, and Giancarlo Stanton drove in runs for the Yankees.
Aaron Judge secured the final out for New York.
The game almost turned into a fracas when Volpe slapped a hard tag on Maikel Garcia at second base to complete a double play, leading to a near-physical altercation between players.
Pre-Game Insights: In 2023, the Royals' season ended here, and they didn't get into the postseason.
The Royals went from a 106-loss laughingstock a year ago to making their first postseason appearance since winning the 2015 World Series.
Post-Match Reflections: Yankees manager Aaron Boone said, 'Proud of these guys. We get to go play for it now and we're excited about that.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees won 50 games away from home in the regular season, their most in 21 years.
